title: Laravel News Podcast
description: The Laravel News Podcast brings you all the latest news and events related to Laravel.

items.title: Laracon Sessions with Taylor Otwell, Jeffrey Way, Matt Stauffer, and Adam Wathan
items.content_text: In the final Laracon Sessions episode for 2017, Jake and Michael are joined by Taylor Otwell, Jeffrey Way, Matt Stauffer, and Adam Wathan to get the final word on the upcoming Laracon US conference in New York City.
items.content_html:
In the final Laracon Sessions episode for 2017, Jake and Michael are joined by Taylor Otwell, Jeffrey Way, Matt Stauffer, and Adam Wathan to get the final word on the upcoming Laracon US conference in New York City.

You can read the full episode transcript which includes time markers and links.

Guest Starring

  • Taylor Otwell
  • Jeffrey Way
  • Matt Stauffer
  • Adam Wathan

Show Links

  • Beau Simensen - Mixcloud
  • Chainable jobs
  • Custom validation rules
  • RefreshDatabase trait
  • Custom Blade if statements
  • Trusted Proxy
  • Request::validate()
  • migrate:fresh command
  • Support for Responsable objects
  • Deep Work
  • Mildly Alarming Podcast - It's not Dopayours, it's dopamine
  • Top of the Rock
  • Tom's Restaurant
  • Laravel Forge
  • Envoyer
  • Laracasts
  • Tighten Co.
  • Laravel Up and Running
  • Test Driven Laravel
  • KiteTail - Building KiteTail
items.summary: In the final Laracon Sessions episode for 2017, Jake and Michael are joined by Taylor Otwell, Jeffrey Way, Matt Stauffer, and Adam Wathan to get the final word on the upcoming Laracon US conference in New York City.

items.title: Laracon Sessions with Michele and Mathias Hansen
items.content_text: In the penultimate Laracon Session, Jake and Michael are joined by husband and wife tag-team speakers Michele and Mathias Hansen to talk about launching and scaling a side project, along with your regular dose of Laravel framework and community news.
items.content_html:

items.title: Laravel Macros, frontend presets, and Jigsaw
items.content_text: Jake and Michael recap a relatively quiet period of change on the Laravel landscape, talking about 5.4 maintenance releases, upcoming features in Laravel 5.5, and some contributions from the community.

items.title: Interview with Mohamed Said, Laravel's First Employee
items.content_text: Get to know Mohamed Said in his first ever interview where we discuss how he got into programming, being Laravel's first ever employee, what it's like working with Taylor Otwell.
items.content_html:
Get to know Mohamed Said in his first ever interview where we discuss how he got into programming, being Laravel's first ever employee, what it's like working with Taylor Otwell.

You can read the full episode transcript which includes time markers and links.

Show Sponsors

  • Eyewitness.io, know how your applications are actually performing. Monitor your queues, schedulers/cron, email, logs, security, SSL, DNS and much more. Dead simple installation - be up and running in just 90 seconds...

Show links

  • In Laravel 5.5 you can render mailables to the browser
  • Laravel 5.5 adds support for email themes in mailables
  • Running Dusk tests on Travis CI and CircleCI
  • Laravel 5.4.17 is released
  • Laravel migrate:fresh command
  • Which Laravel helper do you use for your URLs?
  • Laravel Forge PHP SDK

Tutorials and packages

  • Laravel OPcache package
  • Introduction to seeding data in testing
  • Using Laravel's cache with query params
  • Building a user invitation system with Laravel
items.summary: Get to know Mohamed Said in his first ever interview where we discuss how he got into programming, being Laravel's first ever employee, what it's like working with Taylor Otwell.

items.title: Laravel 5.4 with Taylor Otwell

items.title: Welcome Jacob Bennett and Michael Dyrynda as the new hosts
items.content_text: In this episode, we welcome the new hosts of the podcast.
items.content_html:
Jacob Bennett and Michael Dyrynda will be taking over as hosts of the show going forward and this episode is a farewell from Jack and Eric and introductions of Jake and Michael.

Apologies in advance for the audio on Eric's end. He had his computer set to use the wrong mic.
items.summary: In this episode, we welcome the new hosts of the podcast.

items.title: Laravel 5.3.18, Yarn, Leanpub, and more.
items.content_text: In this episode, we discuss Yarn, Facebook's new JavaScript package manger, the new Laravel Links section, and lots of other random topics.
items.content_html:
In this episode, we discuss Yarn, Facebook's new JavaScript package manger, the new Laravel Links section, and lots of other random topics.

This is our last podcast episode for 2016 and we will be taking a break until next year.

items.title: The Laracon US 2016 Special With Taylor Otwell, Evan You, Chris Fidao, and Adam Wathan
items.content_text: LN22: A special "Laracon" edition of the podcast. In this episode, we chat with Taylor Otwell, Evan You, Adam Wathan, and Chris Fidao about their talks at Laracon, projects they're working on, getting the most out of the conference and more.
items.content_html:
A special "Laracon" edition of the podcast.

In this episode, we chat with Taylor Otwell, Evan You, Adam Wathan, and Chris Fidao about their talks at Laracon, projects they're working on, getting the most out of the conference and more. There's great stuff here, even if you're not attending!

  • Larachat Archive

  • Jacks article on Anonymous Functions on dotdev.co

items.title: A look at what's coming to Laravel 5.3

items.content_html:
• A look at what's coming to Laravel 5.3
  • Building a Status Board using Laravel and Vue
  • Oh my zsh
  • Auto embed email package
  • Using Webmin admin console (youtube video by Roy Verrips)

Tip of the day:

Make the CD command case insensitive by adding the following to your ~/.inputrc file:

set completion-ignore-case on

As seen in the free book: Working with Forge Servers

items.title: Jack reads the news
items.content_text: LN18: Jack reads the Laravel related news this week.
items.content_html:
Jack reads the laravel related news this week. Eric is off this week.

All the news from issue 105 of the Laravel-News.com newsletter.

  • Laravel is turning 5
  • Original "Introducing Laravel" post from Taylor
  • New Spark Tutorial added this week.
  • Several new articles on dotdev.co on using git for Branching, merging and rebasing (great articles)
  • Several articles on using view Composers
  • Contract testing
  • Multiple Migrations Paths coming in Laravel 5.3
  • Cascading softdeletes with Laravel 5 (package)
  • Scaffolding with custom commands by Amo Chohan
  • Laravel API generator
  • Laravel Docusign
  • Request rate limiter middleware for Laravel 5.2+

items.title: Laravel Valet with Taylor Otwell and Adam Wathan
items.content_text:
LN16: Laravel Valet is a new high-speed development environment by Taylor Otwell and Adam Wathan.

In this special edition episode of the Laravel News Podcast Eric and Jack are Joined by Taylor and Adam as they discuss everything about Valet, how it came to be and the amazingly short time from idea to completed product. They talk about the internals, how it works, how external sharing works, the driver architecture and more.
items.content_html:
Laravel Valet is a new high-speed development environment by Taylor Otwell and Adam Wathan.

In this special edition episode of the Laravel News Podcast Eric and Jack are Joined by Taylor and Adam as they discuss everything about Valet, how it came to be and the amazingly short time from idea to completed product. They talk about the internals, how it works, how external sharing works, the driver architecture and more.

An audio copy of the Official Valet Commerical is at the end of the episode

Show Links

  • Valet Announcement
  • First look at Valet
  • The magic behind Valet
items.summary:
LN16: Laravel Valet is a new high-speed development environment by Taylor Otwell and Adam Wathan.

In this special edition episode of the Laravel News Podcast Eric and Jack are Joined by Taylor and Adam as they discuss everything about Valet, how it came to be and the amazingly short time from idea to completed product. They talk about the internals, how it works, how external sharing works, the driver architecture and more.

items.title: Interview with Mike Bronner about his early experiences with Laravel Spark
items.content_text: LN15: Jack reads the news and interviews Mike Bronner while Eric takes a much needed week off.
items.content_html:
Jack reads the news and interviews Mike Bronner while Eric takes a much needed week off.

  • Eric sent out his 100th episode of the Laravel News Newsletter!
  • Interview with Mike Bronner (@mikebronner) who shares his experiences being one of the first users to get Spark into production.
  • Mike talked about larachat live @larachatlive that meet Thursdays at 7pm CST
  • ViewJS 2.0
  • PHP RFC: Pipe operator

Book updates:

  • Easy Laravel 5 Book and companion Website
  • Laravel 5.2 for beginners by Bill Keck
  • CodeSmart by Dayle Rees
  • Working With Forge Servers -by Jack Fruh & Friends

Tutorials:

  • Generate Fake Localized data with laravel
  • Tweet Streaming With laravel by Daniel Abernathy
  • Using SparkPost for Transactional emails with Laravel
  • Run tests inside your deploy script
  • EcmaScript 6 Crash Course
  • Conditionally adding to Laravel Query Builder

Packages:

  • BeautyMail
  • Laravel Generators
  • Laravel Friendships
  • UUID generator
  • Spatie Laravel Newsletter Package
items.summary: LN15: Jack reads the news and interviews Mike Bronner while Eric takes a much needed week off.

items.title: Laravel Spark with Taylor Otwell
items.content_text: LN14: Laravel Spark is here and Taylor Otwell is here to talk about it!!!
items.content_html:
This week Taylor Otwell joins us to talk all about Spark!

Show links:

  • Laravel Spark Beta
  • Composer "Gold" Floppy sells for >$1400USD!
  • Laravel Cheat Sheets.
items.summary: LN14: Laravel Spark is here and Taylor Otwell is here to talk about it!!!

items.title: Covering  a few community Laravel packages
items.content_text: LN13: Laravel Exception Reporter, Chrome Bandwidth limiter, Chrome extension to generate Laravel tests, Jigsaw, Helpspot Vault, Fixing MySql Memory, Sparkwatch, Taxes, Jack runs into a laravel problem that Eric helps with.
items.content_html:
In this episode we talk about Laravel Exception Reporter, Chrome Bandwidth limiter, Chrome extension to generate Laravel tests, Jigsaw, Helpspot Vault, Fixing MySql Memory, Sparkwatch, Taxes, Jack runs into a laravel problem that Eric helps with.

  • Spark breaking news
  • 3:15 Laravel Exception reporter - emails you anytime an exception is logged.
  • 5:30 Chrome bandwidth limiter for testing.
  • 7:10 Chrome extension to generate Laravel tests.
  • 9:55 Jigsaw
  • 13:20 Userscape helpspot Vault - an expiring way to send info.
  • 15:10 Dropbox - share a file for a week
  • 17:00 Mysql is still holding for Jack on 2gb,
  • 17:15 Laravel tweeted that Mysql might know the root cause.
  • 17:20 James Fairhurst wrote to tell us that Forge servers do not have swap files and it's just a few commands to add one.
  • 19:10 SparkWatch continues, Jack predicts the 100th day of the year. April 9th.
  • 22:00 taxes in the US - Jack and Eric chat about paying taxes on side work.
  • 33:15 Eric helps Jack through a laravel problem involving a complex query and how to get that into a blade template.

Show links

  • Chrome extension to generate tests
  • Exception Recorder
  • Jigsaw
  • Vault
  • Adding a swap file to a linux box

PS (We don't say in the show what spark is, it's a starter project that has billing, invoicing, subscriptions, user management and more built in)

Also Star Wars Force unleashed was released on DVD and BluRay today...
items.summary: LN13: Laravel Exception Reporter, Chrome Bandwidth limiter, Chrome extension to generate Laravel tests, Jigsaw, Helpspot Vault, Fixing MySql Memory, Sparkwatch, Taxes, Jack runs into a laravel problem that Eric helps with.

items.title: Composer updates, Laravel Backup 3, Katana, Mail Preview Driver, and more...
items.content_text: LN12: In this episode, we talk about the latest Laravel news including Composer updates, Github Relaxing their API limit, Laravel internals moving to Github issues. Then we talk about a few recent packages released including Katana, Laravel Backup 3, and a new mail preview driver.
items.content_html:
In this episode, we talk about the latest Laravel news including Composer updates, Github Relaxing their API limit, Laravel internals moving to Github issues. Then we talk about a few recent packages released including Katana, Laravel Backup 3, and a new mail preview driver.

News this week

  • Internals moved to Github
  • Github removes the API limit on composer installs
  • Update composer.json

Code and Packages

  • Katana
  • Laravel Backup 3
  • Mail preview driver

Easter Eggs.

Yep, this episode has several. They're easy to find if you start at the beginning and listen until the end...
items.summary: LN12: In this episode, we talk about the latest Laravel news including Composer updates, Github Relaxing their API limit, Laravel internals moving to Github issues. Then we talk about a few recent packages released including Katana, Laravel Backup 3, and a new mail preview driver.

items.title: Laracon, Laravel 5.2, Simplecast, Linode, and Project Management
items.content_text: LN07: We kick off 2016 with a discussion on Upgrading to Laravel 5.2, Laracon, the Linode DoS attack, And simple project management tips that have made us more productive.
items.content_html:
We kick off 2016 with a discussion on Upgrading to Laravel 5.2, Laracon, the Linode DoS attack, And simple project management tips that have made us more productive.

Show Links:

  • Laravel Shift
  • Lumen 5.2
  • Linode Outage

Attribution to http://www.freesfx.co.uk/ for the record scratch sound effect.

items.title: PHP7, Laravel 5.2, LaraVer, and interviews with Colin O'Dell and Mike Bronner
items.content_text: LN06: We're joined by Colin O'Dell and Mike Bronner this week. Colin talks to us about new features in PHP7, Mike talks to us about Laraver.xyz and Eric and Jack talk about stuff we've heard about Laravel 5.2, Flexbox Froggy, Lets Encrypt
items.content_html:
Show Notes

PHP 7:

Colin O'Dell, author of PHP 7 UpgradeGuide Joins us to share new features of PHP7 and advice on things listeners might want to check before upgrading to PHP7.

Laraver

Mike Bronner joins us to talk about Laraver.xyz a new service that monitors the change logs for Laravel in Github

Show Links

  • What is coming to Laravel 5.2?

  • Forge now supports LetsEncrypt.

  • Flexbox Froggy is a cool intro to learn flexbox.

End of year update

This is our last episode for 2015, we'll be back on January 8th with more Laravel News!
items.summary: LN06: We're joined by Colin O'Dell and Mike Bronner this week. Colin talks to us about new features in PHP7, Mike talks to us about Laraver.xyz and Eric and Jack talk about stuff we've heard about Laravel 5.2, Flexbox Froggy, Lets Encrypt

items.title: Laravel Quickstart Tutorials
items.content_text: LN03: Laravel Quickstart Guides, New Features coming to Laravel 5.2, Bootstrap/Sass/Elixir, Laravel Tagging Package, Password strength, Why Developers hate being interrupted.
items.content_html:
In this episode of the Laravel News Podcast, we discuss the new Laravel quick start guides, new features coming to Laravel 5.2, Elixir and Bootstrap, Developer interruptions and more!

Show Links

  • New Laravel guides. Quick Start and Intermediate
  • New features coming to Laravel 5.2
    • Implicit Model Binding
    • Output from scheduled tasks
    • Array validation -- Taylor's Reaction
  • Bootstrap Sass Elixir
  • Why developer hate being interrupted
  • Laravel Tagging Package
  • Passwords
    • Forcing more complex passwords in Laravel
    • Stop forcing your password rules on me
  • Google is adding podcasts and we are in it.
items.summary: LN03: Laravel Quickstart Guides, New Features coming to Laravel 5.2, Bootstrap/Sass/Elixir, Laravel Tagging Package, Password strength, Why Developers hate being interrupted.
